intro: Grewia isochroa, commonly known as the red gooseberry, is a small shrub native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its small, bright red berries that are often eaten by birds and mammals. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are oval-shaped with serrated edges. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Grewia isochroa is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
